page.title: 20HOUSING
page.content:
HANSON HOUSE (cont). John Galloway lived here 1874 to 1894 and it was he who designed and build the first locomotive for the Manchester - Liverpool Railway. The original drawing for this is at Hanson House. HILL HOUSE. Robert Robinson bought the house in 1612 along with 7 messuages & 11 cottages from Sir John Radcliffe of Ordsall. In 1701 Ephraim Bradbury ' was drowned in a tanne pitte' when the buildings were used as a tannery. In 1725 the then owner drowned near Ashley Hall. Later Symonds Atlee lodged at the house when he was curate at Mobberley church. It was his nephew who was to become Prime Minister.
{CREDITS:- }J. Bailey, L. McDonough, D. Moore, J. Walton, P. Theobold, P. Beardsell, M Buckley,J. Cooke & other members of Styal W.I.
